translated: The Explanation of the Section on Causes

original: Ye keci kusalā dhammā, sabbe te kusalahetūti … ?🔽Tayoeva kusalahetū, avasesā kusalā dhammā na kusalahetū …pe… kusalanidānā … kusalasambhavā
analyzed: ye keci kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te kusala hetu uti  tayo eva kusala hetū avasesā kusalāḥ dhammāḥ na kusala hetū pe kusala nidānā kusala sambhavā
translated: Are any wholesome thoughts all wholesome roots?

original: … kusalappabhavā … kusalasamuṭṭhānā … kusalāhārā … kusalārammaṇā … kusalapaccayā … kusalasamudayā ….
analyzed: kusala ppabhavā kusala samuṭṭhānā kusala āhārā kusala ārammaṇā kusala paccayā kusala samudayā
translated: The three wholesome roots are wholesome roots, and the rest of the wholesome thoughts are not wholesome roots. … Are wholesome thoughts all wholesome sources, all wholesome origins, all wholesome birthplaces, all wholesome manifestations, all wholesome causes, all wholesome occurrences?

original: Ye keci akusalā dhammā … ye keci abyākatā dhammā … ye keci nāmā dhammā, sabbe te🔽nāmahetūti … nāmanidānā … nāmasambhavā … nāmappabhavā … nāmasamuṭṭhānā … nāmāhārā
analyzed: ye keci akusalāḥ dhammāḥ ye keci abyākatāḥ dhammāḥ ye keci nāmāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe te  nāma hetū ti nāma nidānāḥ nāma sambhavāḥ nāma ppabhavāḥ nāma samuṭṭhānāḥ nāma āhārāḥ
translated: Are any unwholesome thoughts … Are any indeterminate thoughts … Are any thoughts that are names all name roots?🔽The three wholesome roots are name roots, and the rest of the wholesome thoughts are not name roots. … Are wholesome thoughts all name sources, all name origins, all name birthplaces, all name manifestations, all name causes, all name occurrences?

analyzed: nāma ārammaṇāḥ nāma paccayāḥ nāma samudayāḥ
translated: The three wholesome roots are name sources, and the rest of the wholesome thoughts are not name sources. … Are wholesome thoughts all name sources, all name origins, all name birthplaces, all name manifestations, all name causes, all name occurrences?
The root, the cause, the source,
The manifestation, the nutriment, the object,

analyzed: paccayaḥ samudayena ca ati  niddesa vāraḥ niṭṭhito
translated: The condition, and the occurrence.🔽The section on explanation is finished.
The section on the root-enumeration is finished.
